column4: hello, i have a question about nic's in ubuntu could anyone help me?
My nic isnt working is their a way to chech this
I type ifconfig -a I see my nic their..
what kind of nic is it?
No I have set a static Ip
what happens when you run 'ping -c 4 google.com' ?
It isnt connected to the internet, it has a ip off 192.168.0.10 and connected to 192.168.0.12
All the ip settings are correct, the ubuntu system has 2 nics. ETH0 and ETH2, ETH0 says UP broadcast Running multicast (this nic is working fine). But ETH2 only says Broadcast Multicast
All the ip settings are correct, the ubuntu system has 2 nics. ETH0 and ETH2, ETH0 says UP broadcast Running multicast (this nic is working fine). But ETH2 only says Broadcast Multicast
is eth0 the one with the IP settings?
No ETH0 has DHCP activated ETH2 Has Static IP
and you want to just use eth2?
ETH0 is connected to the router (who offers DHCP) (connects on ETH0) on ETH2 a Switch is being connected and several clients
This machine will be a firewall/router
I don't know anything about running a router
But the problem is I cant get my client working with another client
